archie.methodology: About the simulator: We estimate odds by randomly simulating the remainder of the season thousands of times and counting how often each team makes the playoffs, gets the No. 1 seed, the No. 1 draft pick and so on. We estimate each team’s probability of winning each remaining game using a statistical forecast that incorporates a host of data, including team records, roster changes, weather, game location and more advanced measures like expected points added and success rate.
archie.credits: By Ryan Best, David Haye, Elliot Jordan, Junghye Kim, Austin Mock, Matt Myers, Thomas Oide, Laura Pelton, Yuriko Schumacher and Oliver Viehweger
archie.note: Adapted from The New York Times’s NFL Playoff Simulator.
archie.index_header_sub: Each team’s path to the postseason
archie.index_intro_p1: Welcome to The Athletic’s 2025 NFL Playoff Simulator, where you’ll find everything you need to know about all the ways your favorite team’s season could end, from a No. 1 playoff seed to the No. 1 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft.
archie.index_intro_p2: The tables above represent our best guess for the final playoff picture, along with a view of the standings if the season ended today. Below, you’ll find much more detailed estimates for all 32 NFL teams. All these estimates are powered by Austin Mock’s NFL Projection Model. You can read more about this tool and how it works right here, and send in your questions to AskAustin@theathletic.com.
archie.draft_intro: If you’re looking ahead to next season, this is the place to do it. Here are our estimates for the order of the 2026 NFL Draft, updated with each game result.
archie.sim_p1: With {{ N }} games remaining, the {{ team_name }} have {{ percent_chance }} chance to {{ scenario }}. This interactive tool is designed to help you explore which games matter most for the rest of the {{ team_name_short }}’ season. As you pick winners of games, the colors on some games will change, reflecting their relative importance. Use the dropdown below to explore other outcomes.
archie.sim_p2: The tables below represent all NFL games remaining. While the {{ team_name }}’ games are typically the most important, outcomes from other games can affect the {{ team_name }}’ chances indirectly. Pick winners and explore which games matter most.
archie.draft_pick_hed: {{ team_name }}’ likelihood of each 2026 draft pick position
archie.details_p1: Below are our estimates for the {{ team_name }}’ chances at all playoff outcomes since the beginning of the season. These figures are updated after every NFL game and occasionally when there is a player injury or other roster news.
archie.area_hed: How the {{ team_name }}’ chances have changed
archie.details_p2: Here you’ll find our estimates for all remaining combinations of records the {{ team_name }} may end the season with.

austin_updates.text: After losing to the Bills on Sunday, the Chiefs' playoff odds drop to 73%.
Since the start of the season, the Colts playoff odds increased by 55%.
After upsetting the Packers in Green Bay, the Panthers' playoff odds rose from 8% to 19%.
The 3-5 Texans playoff odds sit at 9% despite entering the season as the AFC South favorites.
Jayden Daniels left Sunday night's game with his third separate injury this season as the 3-6 Commanders have just a 1% chance to make the playoffs.
